job_description: As Vice President of Business Development, you'll report directly to the Chief Business Officer. Your role involves spearheading essential efforts to access external therapeutic programs and technologies. This includes overseeing the sourcing, evaluation, and negotiation of in-licensing, collaboration, M&A, equity, and out-licensing deals. Responsibilities: Lead development of Business Development strategies. Support Chief Business Officer (CBO) and leadership team on tactical execution. Drive identification of potential collaborations through opportunity analyses, meetings, and data review. Implement plans to engage key collaborators and decision-makers. Lead CDA and MTA agreement negotiation efforts. Lead deal negotiations and develop draft Collaboration and Licensing Agreements. Develop deep knowledge of market landscapes, trends, and trial outcomes. Perform financial and market modelling in Microsoft Excel. Lead and maintain partnership activity tracking and documentation. Collaborate with CBO on formulation and execution of business strategies. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in business, quantitative, or life sciences field required; 18 years of relevant experience preferred. Minimum of 12 years' experience in pharmaceutical/biotech or healthcare consulting. Executive business development experience, including market assessments, financial modelling, and contract generation. Proven success in identifying and executing licensing agreements. Strong skills in business, negotiation, project management, and analytical decision-making. Knowledge of pharmaceutical and biotech clinical development and regulatory processes. Familiarity with medical device development and regulatory processes preferred. Master's and/or PhD preferred. Deep network across major pharmaceutical and biotech companies. Deal sheet summarising accomplishments required.

Qualifications: Minimum of 12 years' experience in pharmaceutical/biotech or healthcare consulting
Executive business development experience, including market assessments, financial modelling, and contract generation
Proven success in identifying and executing licensing agreements
Strong skills in business, negotiation, project management, and analytical decision-making
Knowledge of pharmaceutical and biotech clinical development and regulatory processes
